hero.headline: Building innovation systems in global companies.
hero.subline: From design to innovation management. From creative agencies where imagination leads to corporations where compliance rules. I bridge the gap between creative possibility and corporate reality. Making innovation work where risk tolerance is low and stakes are high.

problem.text: Every process, every approval chain, every meeting structure exists to keep things stable.
problem.pullquote: Which makes sense. You don't want chaos.

question.text: But then the market shifts. Customers want something new. The company needs to adapt. And the immune system kicks in.

whatIDo.text:
I work in the space between ideas and organisations.

I take early, ambiguous opportunities and help teams push them far enough that real decisions can be made. Invest, change direction, or stop.

My work is less about ideation and more about what comes after. Creating structure, momentum, and protection so promising ideas do not get crushed by timelines, politics, or premature ROI questions.

I spend most of my time translating. Between strategy and execution. Leadership and teams. Ambition and reality. So progress actually happens.
whatIDo.pullquote: Innovation is not about ideas. It’s about getting to decisions.

items.title: Killed a 2M project before it wasted 18 months
Got a stuck product to market 8 months faster
Turned a customer complaint into a new revenue stream

contact.headline: Sometimes a short conversation is enough to unlock the next step.
contact.text:
I’m not for every problem.
But I’m very good when the problem isn’t obvious yet.
